com.qualcomm.hardware.bosch

Interface BNO055IMU

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdafruitBNO055IMU, BNO055IMUImpl, LynxEmbeddedIMU

    public interface BNO055IMU
    BNO055IMU interface abstracts the functionality of the Bosch/Sensortec BNO055 Intelligent 9-axis absolute orientation sensor. The BNO055 can output the following sensor data (as described in AdaFruit Absolute Orientation Sensor).
    1. Absolute Orientation (Euler Vector, 100Hz) Three axis orientation data based on a 360Â° sphere
    2. Absolute Orientation (Quaterion, 100Hz) Four point quaternion output for more accurate data manipulation
    3. Angular Velocity Vector (100Hz) Three axis of 'rotation speed' in rad/s
    4. Acceleration Vector (100Hz) Three axis of acceleration (gravity + linear motion) in m/s^2
    5. Magnetic Field Strength Vector (20Hz) Three axis of magnetic field sensing in micro Tesla (uT)
    6. Linear Acceleration Vector (100Hz) Three axis of linear acceleration data (acceleration minus gravity) in m/s^2
    7. Gravity Vector (100Hz) Three axis of gravitational acceleration (minus any movement) in m/s^2
    8. Temperature (1Hz) Ambient temperature in degrees celsius

    Of those, the first (the gravity-corrected absolute orientation vector) is arguably the most useful in FTC robot design. It's really handy.

    See Also:
    BNO055IMUImpl, BNO055 product page, BNO055 specification

      static interface  BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator
      BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator encapsulates an algorithm for integrating acceleration information over time to produce velocity and position.

      Sensor modes are described in Table 3-5 (p21) of the BNO055 specification, where they are termed "operation modes".

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        boolean initialize(BNO055IMU.Parameters parameters)
        Initialize the sensor using the indicated set of parameters. Note that the execution of this method can take a fairly long while, possibly several tens of milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        parameters - the parameters with which to initialize the device
        Returns:
        whether initialization was successful or not

      • getParameters

        BNO055IMU.Parameters getParameters()
        Returns the parameters which which initialization was last attempted, if any
        Returns:
        the parameters which which initialization was last attempted, if any

      • close

        void close()
        Shut down the sensor. This doesn't do anything in the hardware device itself, but rather shuts down any resources (threads, etc) that we use to communicate with it. It is rare that user code has a need to call this method.

      • getAngularOrientation

        Orientation getAngularOrientation()
        Returns the absolute orientation of the sensor as a set three angles
        Returns:
        the absolute orientation of the sensor
        See Also:
        getQuaternionOrientation(), Orientation, getAngularOrientation(AxesReference, AxesOrder, org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AngleUnit)

      • getAngularOrientation

        Orientation getAngularOrientation(AxesReference reference,
                                  AxesOrder order,
                                  org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AngleUnit angleUnit)
        Returns the absolute orientation of the sensor as a set three angles with indicated parameters.
        Parameters:
        reference - the axes reference in which the result will be expressed
        order - the axes order in which the result will be expressed
        angleUnit - the angle units in which the result will be expressed
        Returns:
        the absolute orientation of the sensor
        See Also:
        Orientation, getAngularOrientation()

      • getOverallAcceleration

        Acceleration getOverallAcceleration()
        Returns the overall acceleration experienced by the sensor. This is composed of a component due to the movement of the sensor and a component due to the force of gravity.
        Returns:
        the overall acceleration vector experienced by the sensor
        See Also:
        getLinearAcceleration(), getGravity()

      • getAngularVelocity

        AngularVelocity getAngularVelocity()
        Returns the rate of change of the absolute orientation of the sensor.
        Returns:
        the rate at which the orientation of the sensor is changing.
        See Also:
        getAngularOrientation()

      • getLinearAcceleration

        Acceleration getLinearAcceleration()
        Returns the acceleration experienced by the sensor due to the movement of the sensor.
        Returns:
        the acceleration vector of the sensor due to its movement
        See Also:
        getOverallAcceleration(), getGravity()

      • getGravity

        Acceleration getGravity()
        Returns the direction of the force of gravity relative to the sensor.
        Returns:
        the acceleration vector of gravity relative to the sensor
        See Also:
        getOverallAcceleration(), getLinearAcceleration()

      • getTemperature

        Temperature getTemperature()
        Returns the current temperature.
        Returns:
        the current temperature

      • getMagneticFieldStrength

        MagneticFlux getMagneticFieldStrength()
        Returns the magnetic field strength experienced by the sensor. See Section 3.6.5.2 of the BNO055 specification.
        Returns:
        the magnetic field strength experienced by the sensor

        the absolute orientation of the sensor
        See Also:

      • getPosition

        Position getPosition()
        Returns the current position of the sensor as calculated by doubly integrating the observed sensor accelerations.
        Returns:
        the current position of the sensor.
        See Also:
        BNO055IMU.Parameters.accelerationIntegrationAlgorithm, startAccelerationIntegration(Position, Velocity, int)

      • getVelocity

        Velocity getVelocity()
        Returns the current velocity of the sensor as calculated by integrating the observed sensor accelerations.
        Returns:
        the current velocity of the sensor
        See Also:
        BNO055IMU.Parameters.accelerationIntegrationAlgorithm, startAccelerationIntegration(Position, Velocity, int)

      • getAcceleration

        Acceleration getAcceleration()
        Returns the last observed acceleration of the sensor. Note that this does not communicate with the sensor, but rather returns the most recent value reported to the acceleration integration algorithm.
        Returns:
        the last observed acceleration of the sensor
        See Also:
        getLinearAcceleration(), BNO055IMU.Parameters.accelerationIntegrationAlgorithm, startAccelerationIntegration(Position, Velocity, int)

      • startAccelerationIntegration

        void startAccelerationIntegration(Position initialPosition,
                                  Velocity initialVelocity,
                                  int msPollInterval)
        Start (or re-start) a thread that continuously at intervals polls the current linear acceleration of the sensor and integrates it to provide velocity and position information.
        Parameters:
        initialPosition - If non-null, the current sensor position is set to this value. If null, the current sensor position is unchanged.
        initialVelocity - If non-null, the current sensor velocity is set to this value. If null, the current sensor velocity is unchanged.
        msPollInterval - the interval to use, in milliseconds, between successive calls to getLinearAcceleration()
        See Also:
        stopAccelerationIntegration(), BNO055IMU.AccelerationIntegrator

      • stopAccelerationIntegration

        void stopAccelerationIntegration()
        Stop the integration thread if it is currently running.
        See Also:
        startAccelerationIntegration(Position, Velocity, int)

      • getSystemStatus

        BNO055IMU.SystemStatus getSystemStatus()
        Returns the current status of the system.
        Returns:
        the current status of the system See section 4.3.58 of the BNO055 specification.
        See Also:
        ResultMeaning
        0idle
        1system error
        2initializing peripherals
        3system initialization
        4executing self-test
        5sensor fusion algorithm running
        6system running without fusion algorithms

      • getSystemError

        BNO055IMU.SystemError getSystemError()
        If getSystemStatus() is 'system error' (1), returns particulars regarding that error. See section 4.3.58 of the BNO055 specification.
        Returns:
        the current error status
        See Also:
        ResultMeaning
        0no error
        1peripheral initialization error
        2system initialization error
        3self test result failed
        4register map value out of range
        5register map address out of range
        6register map write error
        7BNO low power mode not available for selected operation mode
        8accelerometer power mode not available
        9fusion algorithm configuration error
        Asensor configuration error

      • getCalibrationStatus

        BNO055IMU.CalibrationStatus getCalibrationStatus()
        Returns the calibration status of the IMU
        Returns:
        the calibration status of the IMU

      • isSystemCalibrated

        boolean isSystemCalibrated()
        Answers as to whether the system is fully calibrated. The system is fully calibrated if the gyro, accelerometer, and magnetometer are fully calibrated.
        Returns:
        whether the system is fully calibrated.

      • isGyroCalibrated

        boolean isGyroCalibrated()
        Answers as to whether the gyro is fully calibrated.
        Returns:
        whether the gyro is fully calibrated.

        Returns:
        whether the accelerometer is fully calibrated.

      • isMagnetometerCalibrated

        Returns:
        whether the magnetometer is fully calibrated.

      • readCalibrationData

        BNO055IMU.CalibrationData readCalibrationData()
        Read calibration data from the IMU which later can be restored with writeCalibrationData(). This might be persistently stored, and reapplied at a later power-on. For greatest utility, full calibration should be achieved before reading the calibration data.
        Returns:
        the calibration data
        See Also:
        writeCalibrationData(CalibrationData)

      • writeCalibrationData

        void writeCalibrationData(BNO055IMU.CalibrationData data)
        Write calibration data previously retrieved.
        Parameters:
        data - the calibration data to write
        See Also:
        readCalibrationData()
